Sentencas: Recently, there has been a great deal of interest in extending the lattice Boltzmann method (LBM) to model transport phenomena in the non-continuum regime.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: Most of these studies have focused on single-component flows through simple geometries.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: This work examines an ad hoc extension of a recently developed LBM model for multi-component mass diffusion (Joshi et al 2007 J. Phys.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: In order to validate the method, LBM results for ternary diffusion in a two-dimensional channel are compared with predictions of the dusty gas model (DGM) over a range of Knudsen numbers.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: A calibration factor based on the DGM is used in the LBM to correlate Knudsen diffusivity to pore size.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: Results indicate that the LBM can be a useful tool for predicting non-continuum mass diffusion (Kn > 0.001), but additional research is needed to extend the range of applicability of the algorithm for a larger parameter space.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: Guidelines are given on using the methodology described in this work to model non-continuum mass transport in more complex geometries where the DGM is not easily applicable.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: In addition, the non-continuum LBM methodology can be extended to three-dimensions.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion

Sentencas: An envisioned application of this technique is to model non-continuum mass transport in porous solid oxide fuel cell electrodes.
Titulo: Lattice Boltzmann method for multi-component, non-continuum mass diffusion
